name: MessageBatch
documentation:
Represents a batch of messages retrieved from the message store for a specific segment range.

A message batch contains a list of {@link SerializedMessage} instances and metadata such as the last known index and the {@link Position} of the consumer when this batch was read.

The {@code segment} and {@code position} fields are especially relevant when the tracker operates with {@code ignoreSegment=true}, meaning segment filtering is handled on the client side. In such cases, the Runtime returns all potentially matching messages, and the client uses the {@link Position} and {@code segment} range to determine which messages are truly relevant for processing.

fields.name: caughtUp
fields.documentation: Indicates whether the tracker has caught up with all available messages in the log.

fields.name: lastIndex
fields.documentation: The highest message index included in this batch. This may be {@code null} if the batch is empty.

fields.name: messages
fields.documentation: The list of messages in this batch.

fields.name: position
fields.documentation: The consumer's position at the time of reading this batch. Used to resume reading or checkpoint progress.

fields.name: segment
fields.documentation:
The segment range this batch belongs to, expressed as a two-element array {@code [start, end]}.

This corresponds to the segment(s) currently claimed by the tracker.

methods.name: getBytes
methods.documentation: Calculates the total number of bytes in the data across all messages within the batch.

methods.name: getSize
methods.documentation: Returns the number of messages contained in this batch.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.documentation: Indicates whether this message batch is empty.

methods.name: toMetric
methods.documentation:
Converts this batch into a compact, serializable representation for monitoring purposes.

 @return a {@link Metric} representing key metadata about this batch
